titleStmt.title: An Electronic Edition of the Mishnah, Tractate Neziqin, from the Hamburg Ms of the Babylonian Talmud
titleStmt.sponsor: Joseph and Rebecca Meyerhoff Center for Jewish Studies
Lieberman Institute; Primary Witnesses to Tannaitic Literature

publicationStmt.pubPlace: The Maryland Institute for Technology in the Humanities

note.p: Based on photo facsimile in , which incorporates the graphic facsimile published by L. Goldschmidt, 1914
Incorporates an original transcription and markup of Bava Metsi'a Ch. 2 by Michael Pollack, revised and edited by Hayim Lapin (Hamb.xml).

msIdentifier.repository: Stats und Universitätsbibilothek Carl von Ossietsky

handNote.note: Colophon, folio 223b: Written Gerona, AM 4944 = 1184 CE.

The manuscript has corrections in at least two handwriting styles: superlinear or marginal corrections in a small hand, generlly semi-cursive, and complete erasure with inserted letters formed to match those of the original scribe. These are all generally all marked "h2" in the markup. The semi-cursive corrections appear to be in a hand similar to the subscription by Judah b. Shemariah del Medigo (f. 223v), and to that of the note of Elijah del Medigo on the cover sheet (f. 1r). Certainty will require further investigation.

revisionDesc.change: Original transcription and tagging of BM Ch. 2 done during Spring Semester 2012
Incorporating additional transcriptions for new demo.

ab.w: הרי Insertion based on Lieberman Institute transcription.
ושור ל Based on the transcription of the Lieberman Institute. Published photos are not sufficiently clear to verify.

ab.note: There appear to be dots marking the transposition, but the quality of the photos does not allow certainty.

בהמ
Marking of erasure follows the Goldschmidt, ed., facsimile. Photo quality is not sufficient to confirm it.
כע א If this is a second hand, scribe has attempted to make the letter form with with the existing text.ור
